articles.headline: Corey Lewandowski, Donald Trump’s Campaign Manager, Is Charged With Battery
articles.snippet: His formal arrest was detailed in a police report that cited new security-camera images showing Mr. Lewandowski pulling a reporter out of his way after Mr. Trump spoke in Florida on March 8.
articles.abstract: His formal arrest was detailed in a police report that cited new security-camera images showing Mr. Lewandowski pulling a reporter out of his way after Mr. Trump spoke in Florida on March 8.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump’s presidential campaign manager, Corey Lewandowski, was charged with battery Tuesday by the police in Jupiter, Fla., who said he had grabbed a reporter this month as she tried to ask Mr. Trump a question.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Michael M. Grynbaum

articles.headline: Technology to Make Clean Energy From Coal Is Stumbling in Practice
articles.snippet: A large-scale project in Canada to capture carbon from a coal-burning power plant has fallen short of its goal and its costs are soaring.
articles.abstract: A large-scale project in Canada to capture carbon from a coal-burning power plant has fallen short of its goal and its costs are soaring.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — An electrical plant on the Saskatchewan prairie was the great hope for industries that burn coal.

articles.headline: Louis Bacon’s Charity Says It Was Victim of Executive Accused of Fraud
articles.snippet: The Moore Charitable Foundation of Louis M. Bacon says it put $25 million into what federal authorities call a fraudulent scheme by Andrew Caspersen.
articles.abstract: The Moore Charitable Foundation of Louis M. Bacon says it put $25 million into what federal authorities call a fraudulent scheme by Andrew Caspersen.
articles.lead_paragraph: The hedge fund billionaire Louis M. Bacon’s charitable foundation was a victim of a fraudulent scheme by the 39-year-old Wall Street executive Andrew Caspersen, the foundation said on Tuesday.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Alexandra Stevenson

articles.headline: Simmering for Decades, Anger About Trade Boils Over in ’16 Election
articles.snippet: Bashing trade deals has proved a winning strategy for Donald Trump, but economists mostly agree they have benefited American households significantly.
articles.abstract: Bashing trade deals has proved a winning strategy for Donald Trump, but economists mostly agree they have benefited American households significantly.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States is in the midst of one of the longest economic expansions in its history. Even American factories have lately added hundreds of thousands of jobs.

articles.headline: Apple’s New Challenge: Learning How the U.S. Cracked Its iPhone
articles.snippet: The company lacks information on the method used to break into the iPhone of a gunman in San Bernardino, Calif.
articles.abstract: The company lacks information on the method used to break into the iPhone of a gunman in San Bernardino, Calif.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Now that the United States government has cracked open an iPhone that belonged to a gunman in the San Bernardino, Calif., mass shooting without Apple’s help, the tech company is under pressure to find and fix the flaw.
articles.byline: By Katie Benner, John Markoff and Nicole Perlroth

articles.headline: Patrolling Disputed Waters, U.S. and China Jockey for Dominance
articles.snippet: Our reporter and photographer visited a Navy cruiser in the South China Sea, where rising tensions are expected to be a focus of talks between President Obama and China’s president this week.
articles.abstract: Our reporter and photographer visited a Navy cruiser in the South China Sea, where rising tensions are expected to be a focus of talks between President Obama and China’s president this week.
articles.lead_paragraph: ABOARD THE U.S.S. CHANCELLORSVILLE, in the South China Sea — The Navy cruiser was in disputed waters off the Spratly Islands when the threat warning sounded over the ship’s intercom: “Away the Snoopie team. ... Away the Snoopie team.”

articles.headline: To Woo Apple, Foxconn Bets $3.5 Billion on Sharp
articles.snippet: The move by the Taiwan manufacturing company is intended to strengthen its ties to the iPhone maker, which uses Sharp screens.
articles.abstract: The move by the Taiwan manufacturing company is intended to strengthen its ties to the iPhone maker, which uses Sharp screens.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The Apple iPhone transformed the technology industry by popularizing the smartphone and blazing a path to a mobile future. But to do it, the company needed an important ally: a penny-pinching Taiwan-based factory operator named Foxconn.

articles.headline: Team of Rival Scientists Comes Together to Fight Zika
articles.snippet: A quest to create a state-of-the-art map of the Aedes aegypti mosquito’s genome involves scientists from assorted disciplines who rarely collaborate.
articles.abstract: A quest to create a state-of-the-art map of the Aedes aegypti mosquito’s genome involves scientists from assorted disciplines who rarely collaborate.
articles.lead_paragraph: With the Zika virus spreading largely unchecked in Latin America and the Caribbean by way of a now-notorious insect, some of the nation’s leading mosquito researchers are striving to assemble a state-of-the-art DNA map that they say will help them fight the disease with the mosquito’s own genetic code.

articles.headline: Car-Pooling Helps Uber Go the Extra Mile
articles.snippet: Riders pay less and drivers transport more riders at once with the UberPool service, which could have a big impact on local economies and the national transportation infrastructure.
articles.abstract: Riders pay less and drivers transport more riders at once with the UberPool service, which could have a big impact on local economies and the national transportation infrastructure.
articles.lead_paragraph: One day not long ago, an Uber driver picked up a passenger in San Francisco’s gritty Tenderloin district. Let’s call our passenger Abby, because her real name has been lost to database anonymization, an effort to keep her identity private.
